title: Web Checker
description: The web checker actor loads URLs to check and checks for common captchas, status codes returned from crawling, as well as calculates the price a user may pay.

urlsToCheck.title: URLs to check
urlsToCheck.description:
A static list of URLs to check for captchas. To be able to add new URLs on the fly, enable the Use request queue option.

For details, see Start URLs in README.
urlsToCheck.sectionDescription: Options that will be passed to the checkers

proxyConfiguration.title: Proxy Configuration
proxyConfiguration.description:
Specifies proxy servers that will be used by the scraper in order to hide its origin.

For details, see Proxy configuration in README.

checkers.cheerio.title: Cheerio
checkers.cheerio.groupDescription: Select which crawler types should be used for checking these domains

saveSnapshot.title: Enabled
saveSnapshot.description: Will save HTML for Cheerio and HTML + screenshot for Puppeteer/Playwright

enqueueAllOnDomain.title: Enqueue any URL on domain (no need for link selector or pseudo URLs)
enqueueAllOnDomain.description: Will enqueue any URLs on the domain

linkSelector.title: Link Selector
linkSelector.description:
A CSS selector saying which links on the page (<a> elements with href attribute) shall be followed and added to the request queue. This setting only applies if Use request queue is enabled. To filter the links added to the queue, use the Pseudo-URLs setting.

If Link selector is empty, the page links are ignored.

For details, see Link selector in README.
linkSelector.sectionDescription: Specific options that are relevant for crawlers

pseudoUrls.title: Pseudo-URLs
pseudoUrls.description:
Specifies what kind of URLs found by Link selector should be added to the request queue. A pseudo-URL is a URL with regular expressions enclosed in [] brackets, e.g. http://www.example.com/[.*]. This setting only applies if the Use request queue option is enabled.

If Pseudo-URLs are omitted, the actor enqueues all links matched by the Link selector.

For details, see Pseudo-URLs in README.

repeatChecksOnProvidedUrls.title: Repeat checks on provided URLs
repeatChecksOnProvidedUrls.description: Will access each URL multiple times. Useful to test the same URL or bypass blocking of the first page.

maxNumberOfPagesCheckedPerDomain.title: Max number of pages checked per domain
maxNumberOfPagesCheckedPerDomain.description:
The maximum number of pages that the checker will load. The checker will stop when this limit is reached. It's always a good idea to set this limit in order to prevent excess platform usage for misconfigured scrapers. Note that the actual number of pages loaded might be slightly higher than this value.

If set to 0, there is no limit.

maxConcurrentPagesCheckedPerDomain.title: Maximum concurrent pages checked per domain
maxConcurrentPagesCheckedPerDomain.description: Specifies the maximum number of pages that can be processed by the checker in parallel for one domain. The checker automatically increases and decreases concurrency based on available system resources. This option enables you to set an upper limit, for example to reduce the load on a target website.

maxConcurrentDomainsChecked.title: Maximum number of concurrent domains checked
maxConcurrentDomainsChecked.description: Specifies the maximum number of domains that should be checked at a time. This setting is relevant when passing in more than one URL to check.

retireBrowserInstanceAfterRequestCount.title: Retire browser instance after request count
retireBrowserInstanceAfterRequestCount.description: How often will the browser itself rotate. Pick a higher number for smaller consumption, pick a lower number to rotate (test) more proxies.

navigationTimeoutSecs.title: Navigation timeout (seconds)
navigationTimeoutSecs.description: Specifies the maximum time in seconds the request will wait for the page to load. If the page is not loaded within this time, the browser will throw an error and the page will be marked as failed.

puppeteer.headfull.title: Headfull browser (XVFB)
puppeteer.headfull.sectionDescription: Options that are passed in to puppeteer when checking

puppeteer.useChrome.title: Use Chrome
puppeteer.useChrome.description: Only works for Puppeteer type! Be careful that Chrome is not guaranteed to work with Puppeteer.

puppeteer.waitFor.title: Wait for
puppeteer.waitFor.description: Only works for Puppeteer type. Will wait on each page. You can provide number in ms or a selector.

puppeteer.memory.title: Memory
puppeteer.memory.description: Must be power of 2 between 128 and 32768.

playwright.headfull.description: If the browser should be headfull or not
